result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Obtaining a Controlled Substance by Fraud
Prescription Drugs - False or Forged Prescription Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard H Malekebu

records.addlTxt:
(1:54 PM case called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom. 
Defendant Richard H Malekebu appeared by phone. Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for Richard H Malekebu. Prosecuting District Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Linzmeier advises the defendant resides in Minnesota and needs to have a travel permit to leave the state and was unable to obtain one in time.
Attorney Linzmeier broaches issue of identification and defendant was only contacted via phone from law enforcement.
State advises it should be found the defendant is waiving right to personal identification.
Attorney Linzmeier advises the defendant is not disputing his identification, but is disputing what let to identification.
State requests the Court find the defendant waives right to personal identification.
Court orders the preliminary hearing will be adjourned and the defendant will be required to appear in person.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

9:30 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard H Malekebu not in court.  Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for Richard H Malekebu.
Attorney Linzmeier states she was informed that Defendant is in custody in Minnesota and will be released mid October, requests preliminary hearing date

10:28 AM Defendant appears via Zoom without counsel. Court advises that he contact the Public Defender's office and is provided preliminary hearing date.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:13 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard H Malekebu not in court.  Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for Richard H Malekebu.
Hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:04 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Loralee Clark in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard H Malekebu appeared by phone.  Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for Richard H Malekebu. 
There is an offer from the State. Zoom appearance authorized for defendant at next hearing.
Hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
No contact with J.P., any Walgreens location in Wisconsin.
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting.

Case called at 11:11 AM. Hearing held via Zoom and in person.
Defendant Richard H Malekebu appeared by phone.  Attorney Alicia Linzmeier in court for Richard H Malekebu.  Attorney Monica Fallon appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives reading of Complaint. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived.
Bond will be mailed to the Defendant to sign and return to the Clerk of Courts. 
Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 5/2/22 at 1:15 PM.
RTN: 5/12/22 at 9:30 AM (Defendant may appear via Zoom).
LETC - Letter to defendant with signature bond ordered in court 4/7/2022. Request to return signed bond and Affidavit of Witness form to Clerk of Court no later than 4/18/2022.

Conditions:
No contact with J.P., any Walgreens location in Wisconsin.
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting.
